question_text: What is the format of a MAC address?
answer_options: 32-bit binary value written as four decimal octets
6-byte hexadecimal value typically shown as six pairs
8-bit ASCII string followed by device ID
correct_answer: 6-byte hexadecimal value typically shown as six pairs
explanation: MAC addresses are 48-bit (6-byte) hexadecimal values displayed as six pairs separated by colons or hyphens (e.g., 00:1A:2B:3C:4D:5E).
